I highly recommend this home! We stayed here when visiting the area for a concert at the Gorge Amphitheater. I’m not a camper so this house was a comfort and had literally everything you’d need and then some! They thought of everything and even left little things to make the stay more enjoyable! A large kitchen for making meals, washer, dryer, comfortable beds, bikes, golf clubs and even stand up paddle boards. Way over the top with everything!
I also recommend the Saturday farmers market which is about 10 minutes away for souvenirs and fresh flowers.
It’s next to a fun water park. We took the SUP to Blue Heron Park about 15 minutes away and ate at Michael’s on the Lake which is only about 10 minutes. I also recommend that place. Everything you need is all within a mile and the Gorge was around 41 minutes away. There’s a lot to do in this little town and Gladys was extremely accommodating leaving everything to make this a stress free trip!

One issue we found was if guests move anything around the house like a blanket to maybe living room area, she does not take that well, we received a call claiming you have taken her blanket without looking around the house or asking her cleaning staff, as later they told her it was right there in the house itself, which is not something visitors should be worried of when they are actually looking for fun times. Due to this confusion we stop after couple of miles trying to help her locate a blanket due to which missed out, on joining a planned surprise birthday.
Overall, I would say our stay was perfect and Darla was great apart from the above event. I would still book at her place again if get a chance to visit Moses lake again and will recommend other guests as well as, confusion may happen sometimes :)
